device_mount: Handheld; Placed loosely around user (e.g., table); Mounted to wall
scale: Social space; Room; Near, personal space
devices_included: Tablet; Whiteboard, large vertical display; Tabletop, large horizontal display; Laptop
use_cases_desc:
"the transfer of data, graphically represented by visual icons, from one displays to another. For example in
meetings, where people with different mobile devices come together in order to share and discuss information."
contribution_desc:
Airlift, a video-based input device, which captures hand and fingertips independent from any display. It can recognize hand gestures and position above / around a tabletop display.

Devices (e.g. tablets, laptops) within the field of view of the camera can be reognized through attached markers. 

The authors propose and interaction technique called Lift-and-Drop, which is similar to Pick-and-Drop, but independent from displays. It can be used to transfer content between devices.
tracking_characteristic: Outside-in tracking; Location 3D; Tracking users and devices
crossdevice_def: Authors use "cross-boundary interaction" to describe cross-device interaction.
